subject: Re: Running JUnit Test Cases from Web Browser
msgSnippet: hi! JunitEE is a JUnit interface that is executed from a webbrowser. It runs as a servlet so it needs a servlet engine such as Tomcat, Orion or Weblogic to
messageBody:
hi!

JunitEE is a JUnit interface that is executed from
a webbrowser. It runs as a servlet so it needs a servlet
engine such as Tomcat, Orion or Weblogic to execute it.

The latest version of JUnitEE that you can find in the CVS
contains also an option to print the tests executed.

You find JUnitEE on http:sourceforge.net/projects/junitee

I think it does about what you request!

regards
Kaarle Kaila


--- In junit@y..., sramaswa007@y... wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I am designing a project to run junit test cases from the
browser.
> Basically the user is given a form where in he types in the test
> class he wants to run and clicks the submit button.
>
> The test case class is called and the results are returned back to
> the browser. I am fine till that part as I am able to call the
> appropriate test case entered by the user and am able to display
the
> results on the browser.
>
> What I also need is that, is there a way to determine and print
what
> test case methods are being run. As in case of the swingui
> (junit.swingui.TestRunner) we have the progress bar indicator that
> tells us how many test cases are run, the failures and errors and
the
> stack trace. Right now I am able to get all the results but once
all
> the test cases have finished running, till then the page displayed
to
> the user is blank. Is there anyway to dynamically show which
method
> in the test case is running and whether its a failure or error or
> success. Please let me know.
>
> Thanks,
> Sri
